page.title: 10The Marsh and Brickcroft(2)
page.content: It is probable that a number of local buildings were constructed from Longton bricks. There were three pits dug at various times and a small railway was built between them. The kiln was built next to the railway so that the bricks could be quickly taken to Preston. The kiln was shaped like an aircraft hangar with a big chimney at one end.It burnt coal.There were thousands of bricks fired at one time. Originally the openings of the kiln were packed with clay to keep the heat in but later iron doors were fitted. The heat given off when the bricks were fired was over-powering. The Brickcroft closed in the mid- sixties along with the railway. Since then the area,now bleak and windswept, has been popular with shooting and fishing enthusiasts.(Graham Chadwick)
